author: holiman
content: Regarding GPRC vs JSON vs REST: Peter chimed in here: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1012#issuecomment-489660765 , and I chimed in here: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1012#issuecomment-489682674 . Throwing out json-rpc in favour of gPRC doesn't make any sense at all, IMO, it's just changing the wireformat. However, throwing out a peer-to-peer-dialogue-protocol (jsonrpc/grpc) in favour of a client-server protocol (rest) _would_ make sense

author: vorot93
content: gRPC has codegen in many languages, JSONRPC does not

author: vorot93
content: Both REST and JSONRPC mean huge JSON overhead that I saw while profiling Sentry, gRPC does not.
